caption: (Translated by Google) Excellent cuisine .. fantastic place  (Original) Excelente cocina.. lugar fantastico
Cozy 🤎
Google prompted me to give a rating. This is a rating from over a year ago. Best to ask what’s wrong than start to assume.
"The food, drinks, service, and atmosphere are excellent and consistent
The service is very prompt. excellent place.

Very fancy place and it’s worth the price. I was here with my wife a few weeks ago. We order Steak and chicken and both of the dishes where very good. The service is top name notch as you should expect from a place like this. Great place!

Open during the COVID-19 crisis and doing such great work! Food continues to be incredible, as always. Staff is attentive, appreciative, and dedicated. Really interesting dine-out drink options. Definitely worth supporting!

Thank you so much for the personalization, attentiveness, and care put into my Easter dinner delivery. Everything was delicious. Looking forward to visiting once your doors re-open. Until then, be well. ❤️  - Paige

The service was exceptional. The food was excellent. The menu was limited and the menu that they have online was not accurate. The one person in our group who has food restrictions had difficulty finding something. She was counting on the offerings on their brunch menu online being what was offered in the restaurant. They were not.
They care.
Great food...try the oysters

There were plenty of tables open but the host made us sit at the bar. We had to ask several times to be moved to a table. Then we had to wait a long time for our order to be taken, when the restaurant was only half full.
Cool
(Translated by Google) Very good service and very good oysters !!!  (Original) Muy buen servicio y muy buenas ostras!!!
(Translated by Google) I loved  (Original) Amei
(Translated by Google) We recommend  (Original) Sehr zu empfehlen
took over an hour for my burger to come out and even then my order was wrong. flavor was average. not worth the money or wait.
Loved everything ! Great place to hangout!
(Translated by Google) Crazy prices small beer $ 10 hamburger with potato side dish $ 20 crazy❗️  (Original) Prezzi folli birra piccola 10 $ hamburger con contorno di patate 20 $ pazzesco❗️
Very good food, service was exceptional. Would recommend to anyone!
Food was amazing and service from Patrick,  stellar.  Highly recommend for everything,  but that smoked salmon avocado toast...mmmm
Lots of great options of the City's most decadent eateries. Even the pickiest eater will find something!
Fantastic barata with truffle and emulsified honey.
Spectacular Burrata and wine!!!
I found this place by accident and decided to schedule a business meeting here. The place is cozy and the food was great.

This was, by a large margin, the worst service I had during the 10 days I was in New York. My S/O and I were the second group to come in, the other was of 3 people.  It took forever to get our order taken, then 45 minutes to get our food. We ordered coffee, that never came, asked for it again while waiting for our food, it still never came. The food was okay, but I did expect more for what it advertises as, the chicken in the chicken sandwich was bland, but some credit, fried well with no burns. Wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone visiting. Go to TimeOut NYC, and eat at a restaurant there. Better food for a better price, and you will actually get your coffee.
Excellent ambiance, nice people there, decent food.
Who are you calling a dumbo?
Delicious food!

I had been here a number of times and always enjoyed the food, service and ambiance. In May of 2019 I held my wedding reception here- it was an intimate dinner for 35 guests. We had the upstairs to ourselves and downstairs was open to patrons. We had a 4-course menu with open bar and also paid a little extra for a champagne toast. Since it was an intimate affair, we wanted to have a really delicious dinner and wonderful experience and Atrium DUMBO delivered on both.  I had initially reserved with Adam who ended up leaving the restaurant but he transitioned me over to Carlo and Kalani for all of the planning. They were both amazing and super responsive and helpful with all of the details leading up to our special day! All of the food was beautiful and perfectly executed, to the point that it impressed my picky family (and chef father). On top of this, the service was top notch. It was such a wonderful evening due to the quality of the food and service. 1000% worth the cost.  My one tip is that I think the upstairs space would be most comfortable for a party of 30 so you could do a long table. Since we had a bit more than that we split the group into 4 tables. I highly recommend Atrium for hosting a private dinner.  Thank you so much to Kalani, Carlo and the amazing team and Atrium for making our special day perfect!

Terrible bartender, no personality and worse drinks. Ordered a dirty martini and I'm still not sure what it was and ate the olives and ditched the drink.  Everything else about the place, food and experience was awesome!

Is a very nice restaurant with a romantic ambient. Dani, the server just came to NY from Boston. Welcome her to NY. Very pleasant and courteous service provided from every host there. Nice food. Very satisfied and glad my BF chose there to celebrate my birthday!!
Great service, awesome wine list and tasty food.
Went here for dinner after my uncle's wedding. Great restaurant and service but some of the food wasn't that good.

I read they are going for a Michelin star . . . . They are a long ways away. Ordered a coktail-waitress forgot to tell me they dont have it, so she never brought anything out. Cool. Couldnt get the omelette egg whites only  . . . Why not??? Are they not using fresh eggs and only egg beaters?? Overly watery and over buttered. Burger over cooked. Honestly one of the most dissapointing things a restaurant can do is overcook your MR burger. Then charge you Dumbo price for it.
The burrata appetizer was amazing. The pickled strawberries were a great touch and paired well with the Rose gel.
This place  is awesome, the food is great, really good cocktails, wine and pretty chill vibe.  I'm definitely will be back.
Small FILLING servings. Me and my roommate were so amazed by how filled we were after how little we ate. It's beyond delicious and the staff is extremely kind!
Overpriced.  The food is fresh though.  But it just is way overpriced for a so so service. Too bad.

A very nice place with good music playing in the background. The halibut I had was on the salty side but not terrible . The cocktails are STRONG and taste good. Overall a good experience and recommend.
I’ve been looking for Chicken in waffles for over a year in NY. FOUND THEM! Amazing food. We loved this place.
I had the avocado toast with poach egg. It was decent, however, a bit smaller than I expected but the toast was toasted good and cripsy.
Terrible food, even more terrible prices

(Translated by Google) Great and enviable position to admire a glimpse of the Manhattan bridge. Impeccable service, kind and friendly staff. Wide selection of wines, exquisite angus cheeseburgers. Highly recommended!!!!!  (Original) Posizione ottima e invidiabile per ammirare uno scorcio del ponte di Manhattan. Servizio impeccabile, personale gentile ed affabile. Ampia scelta di vini, squisito cheeseburger di angus. Altamente consigliato!!!!!

The food wage great, the service was good, but watching the kitchen and chefs like realty TV.  We like sitting do we can watch the kitchen. Everything looked wonderful all carefully prepared.  The food was wonderfully displayed and tasted as good as it looked.

Party of 4 was in and out in 45 min thanks to the server that couldn’t wait to go home. We were rushed out of the restaurant in a pressing bordering with aggressive manner. Another round of drinks wasn’t offered, neither was the dessert. We were not the last nor second to last table there.  Ordered housemade bread was ice-cold in the center, the second one was charred and greasy -drizzled in butter. Cheese board was thrown on the table with no explanation. We were enjoying 5 mysterious cheeses.  It was our second time there - we brought our traveling from the West Coast friends. Left feeling ashamed for the server’s behavior. Not coming back.
I had my first brunch yesterday ! Had a great time and excellent food ! The ambiance is very cool and unique. Friendly stuff, great food and delicious dessert to follow ! Definitely will go back:)
A romantic spot with a lovely plant wall. It's a great place to stop at after a romantic walk across the Brooklyn Bridge.
Cacio e pepe is not the hardest dish to make, but they still failed at cooking the pasta correctly. Also, 2 scoops of ice cream on top of a pineapple slice doesn't constitute a vacherin.
The ambiance was good. The service was excellent. The food was meh. The best was the dessert- mousse, followed by the wine then the main courses- the ny strip was bland, the mahi-mahi was edible.
(Translated by Google) Beautiful world-famous bridge  (Original) Schöne weltbekannte Brücke

(Translated by Google) Very nice place, staff at the top like the boss. Great atmosphere, good music and delicious food. Do not miss !!!!  (Original) Endroit tres sympatique, personnel au top comme le patron. Super ambiance, bonne musique et cuisine delicieuse. Ane pas manquer !!!!

Only giving this place 3 stars bc the service was decent and the layout was nice. The food is what killed it for me. My girlfriend had the omelet ~$16 and I had the cheeseburger ~$20 for brunch. Omelet was nothing special, something that could've been made at home. The cheeseburger came with potato wedges that weren't crispy and I feel like were larger than what a wedge size should be, so it almost felt like it should've been a baked potato. The burger was not too bad, I ordered it well done and it was still juicy, it's just there was too much bun and the carmelized onions made it too slippery to hold together. I know the area is a bit bougie but I don't care, I don't ever want to resort to eating my burger with a knife and fork. 😑 Don't know what else was on the menu, but I suggest ordering something else if you go here.
(Translated by Google) Excellent food ALL great.  (Original) Comida excelente. TODO buenísimo.

Went here for weekend brunch, chicken and waffles was great, but the melon salad was a joke, and we deserved the shame for ordering something so bland.  Now onto the service, waiter was fine, nothing great, nothing bad. The host, on the other hand, was on a power trip. We reserved a table beforehand, asked to be seated upstairs, but told flat out no for despite it being almost empty upstairs.  Asked another person after we were seated to see if we could switch, as we saw seemingly random parties being allowed to sit upstairs. The same host then comes by and asks for my name, as if to put me on some blacklist.

Little on the pricey side but we felt that everything we ordered from the small plates menu was worth it. I was personally blown away by the House Baked Bread (easily one of the top I've had in Brooklyn, mmm so soft and perfect on the inside) while my friend really enjoyed the P.E.I. mussels.
Good place to eat tasty food at reasonable cost!
Amazing spot. We had a delicious brunch - healthy, tasty and fresh topped off with a perfect glass of 2008 Verve. 👌 The Aussie serving us made us feel right at home.
Cool place

This is our go to place for special events (birthdays, our engagement). We love their smoked bread and their duck preparations. The staff is always lovely. It's such a beautiful space along the water.
Nice place
Great food and service! They have an indoor deck that really adds to the interior.  Had brunch this time around, but would come back again for their dinner menu!
on the pricey side but atmosphere and service is good. food is good. neighborhood is good.

The staff were very welcoming and held a table for me at the last minute. The steak was good quality and paired nicely with the beer they recommended. I also lost my receipt and they immediately provided a replacement when I reached out a week later. You can't go wrong with this place!
Solid Food offering with must see views and buzzing vibes. The service is good and the quality price is appreciated. Not on the cheap side but gladly you pay when tasting the plates you order.
Over priced...$17 for a cocktail 😳
(Translated by Google) Very nice place, friendly welcome.  (Original) Très agréable endroit, accueil sympathique.

(Translated by Google) A quiet place to eat well and next to where the billboard image of Sergio Leone's film, "Once Upon a Time in America" ​​was filmed. A classic.  (Original) Un lugar tranquilo donde comer bien y al lado de donde se rodó la imagen de cartelera de la película de Sergio Leone, "Érase una vez en América". Un clásico.
Very solid Good wine list

This was our first time at Atrium DUMBO but definitely not the last. Ambiance was a rare mix of home-feeling and modern vibe. Exquisite service and an outstanding wine selection.  Food-wise, I'd recommend the foi gras and the glazed radishes as starters and the halibut for main. Desserts were delicious as well. We had the chocolate mousse and the grilled pinneapple with coconut sorbet - I'm normally not a fan of the latter but Atrium's take on it's definitely the exception that confirms the rule for me.
Decent food and menu choices. Atmosphere if okay, service is good.
(Translated by Google) A "MUST SEE" in New York !!  (Original) Ein "MUST SEE" in New York!!

I stopped in here on a whim with a friend while we were exploring Dumbo. The restaurant has such a great vibe, with the greenery wall being the definite highlight. My friend got a cocktail she really enjoyed and we both got the Fettuccine Caccio e Pepe - the pasta was thick, chewy and definitely home made. I day dreamed about it for a few days.
Some items tasted good....most so so.

I was on the whole30 and this restaurant had great options for my diet! Definitely get the duck, it's juicy and smokey. Tastes amazing! The potato wedge is classic and wholesome. Seafood platter is delicious! The ambiance and service was top notch. Cant wait to come back again!
Food was alright.  Service was normal. But they charge us the previous table bar drinks on the bill. If I didn't check the bill, we would be overpaying $60.
Food is good, but tiny portions for the price.
(Translated by Google) It's cold!  (Original) 寒くて！
It's a must visit Instagram photo point in Brooklyn

I tried the house made bread with cultured butter, reginetti pasta, and a cup of their dairy-free butternut squash soup. I think the soup was a special for the evening but it literally was the best I've ever had. Absolutely bursting with flavor and a drizzle of high quality olive oil. A+
Delicious food with a nice view on the Manhattan and Brooklyn Bridge
Long waits for just ok food. Think it's popular because of the area!
Good bloody Mary. Food is fine but brunch was expensive for what it is. Nice staff
Nice atmosphere, good food!
Love this place!
Not the best food, but the service is great and they make you feel like your home.
Strip steak and rigatoni were both quite good. Highly recommend sitting outside to enjoy the view. The non-alcoholic cocktails were especially delicious.

We went for brunch. Got the fried check in sandwich with spicy mayo and slaw. Unfortunately, the mayo was not spicy and the sandwich was bland. The wine list is good and Sunday’s offer 1/2 priced bottles. I would not recommend.

Arrived to an already prebooked restaurant, they had   seating at the windows and at the kitchen. We decided to sit at the kitchen. The service was impeccable and the food was incredibly rich. We had a cocktail, a German brew and the chicken for two. Sitting at the kitchen we got a great view of the chef and his staff in action. The team is stellar! Worth a treat for sure especially if you're looking for one.
Lovely place, amazing staff and service.
Food are amazing here. Service top of the line. The house artrium margarita highly recommend 👌 will come back next time definitely
The food is too salty and over priced. The drinks are good. Atmosphere is nice, customer service is a hit or miss. Good to try once and not come back.
nice and hip. relaxing setting. good selection       of wines. foods were nice. specially liked the duck plate. smokey and flavorful!
(Translated by Google) But what a delight, what a delight ...  (Original) Mais quel délice, quel delice...
Great food and good ambience.
Top
Great food, less quantity. Good quality

(Translated by Google) Very nice setting. We ate in front of the kitchens and we could see many dishes that were all very envy. We tasted the Black Angus Burger and Tuna Tartare which were really very good. We also tasted the carrot cake and the chocolate mousse also very good. We recommend this restaurant for the setting as for the quality of the meal. 😉  (Original) Cadre très agréable. Nous avons mangé en face des cuisines et nous avons pu apercevoir de nombreux plats qui donnaient tous très envie. Nous avons goûté le Burger black Angus et le tartare de thon qui étaient vraiment très bon. Nous avons également goûté le carotte cake et la mousse au chocolat également très bon. Nous recommandons ce restaurant pour le cadre comme pour la qualité du repas. 😉
Good food but limited menue

This place is gorgeous to the eye. Love the decorations. The service is also great. The menu sounds amazing, but the actual food is very underwhelming. Small portions, average food, no wow factor. They could do so much more. Very disappointed. I was so excited to try it, and left feeling disappointed.

Sunday evening extraodinaire.  After cycling over 40 miles to see all 5 borough's in the TD Five Boro's bike race, I dipped into Atrium Dumbo for a recharge. A sampling of the plates: oysters on a half shell, scallops with sea greens , local foie gras and for drink's Thyme 44. Nestled in the shadows of the Brooklyn St. bridge this gem with it's bountiful food and snappy drinks made for a wonderful evening of food and drink.
Best cocktails in BK
What a good place for food and drinks and a very nice location too

I came here on my own prior to seeing a show at St Ann’s Warehouse. It was a Saturday night but relatively early. The host was exceptionally pleasant as was the bartender. They were attentive and gracious. The food is excellent but not cheap. I have been here on other occasions and enjoyed the food. There are plenty of places to sit at the window and tables for more formal dining. The cocktail I had was top notch. I had tried to go to Sugarcane nearby the previous night and left after no one took my order for 15 minutes. If you’re in DUMBO try this place!
Very over priced for relatively small portions. Meals came out very quick (we were in and out in about 45 minutes) The quality of the food was good but not worth the cost.
(Translated by Google) Great sandwich with angus burger  (Original) Ottimo il panino con hamburger di angus
My company held a private event and the space was cozy and spacious at the same time.
You can see the river and the Manhattan and Brooklyn bridges
Nice location with very nice staff and really good food.
Simple and impresive A+
French cuisine with an american attitude.
Got here as soon as they opened and everyone was super nice, both the host amd the server helped out with anything, even when it started to get busy.
Poor service, mediocre food, small portions, unreasonably pricey
Great ambience and fantastic food.

(Translated by Google) Fantastic place to enjoy the views of South Manhattan and the bridges of Brooklyn and Manhattan. In addition, from there you can cross to Manhattan x the bridge, and we already know the saying: "the one that crosses the Brooklyn Bridge returns to NY".  (Original) Fantástico lugar para disfrutar de las vistas del Sur de Manhattan y los puentes de Brooklyn y Manhattan. Además, desde allí puedes cruzar hacia Manhattan x el puente, y ya sabemos el dicho: “el que cruza el puente de Brooklyn vuelve a NY”.
Had cocktails and bar snacks. Great service , all the cocktails were high-end and well-made. Moderately high Prices reflected the high quality so try to go during happy hour.
Nice ambience. service and food were excellent. Definitely want to come again!
Amazing food and service.  The waffle was to die for...
Chris rocks behind the bar. Great atmosphere.
Fantastic service, delicious food and great atmosphere. We love coming here and sitting at the chefs bar!
A classy contemporary place serving elegant fare
Convenient location
Nice brunch
Great food and awesome happy hour.
Beautiful ambiance!
All items we ordered were delicious...

(Translated by Google) The place is cozy, concept of cooking in sight, good service (however they delayed in serving us the main course). The food did not seem special to me. Sorry.  (Original) El lugar es acogedor, concepto de cocina a la vista, buena atención (sin embargo se demoraron en servirnos el plato principal). La comida no me pareció nada especial. Lo siento.

Very standard New York brunch fare.  Was underwhelmed by the grilled peach salad entree.  It was literally a couple peach slices with grill marks on six pieces of arugula.  They have avocado toast and Eggs Benedict on the menu.  Enough said.

Too expensive for the quantities. The service was OK. The guy at the entry was super nice but our waitress not that much. The food was OK but nothing special. Mimosas were filled less than half the glass.

I met my crew here for our bimonthly round table discussions.  We'd looked at several places and eventually settled on this one because it was near some of the other activities we were considering that day.  It seems the stars aligned for us.  Before you even enter the restaurant, feast your eyes on the massive, imposing super structure of the Manhattan Bridge. (Do it for the snap maybe?).  The main floor is pretty wide and has a cutaway view to the kitchen. It's also got this awesome looking greenery along one wall and some elevated table seating.  We arrived on time and were seated on the upper level overlooking the main floor and its beautiful vertical garden. Just behind our table was a wall full of cases of wine bottles which perfectly complemented the wood aesthetic elements.  We didn't sample the lunch fare but instead went with brunch.  I had the steak with scrambled eggs (I can't do eggs Benedict or sunny side up. Don't ask me why). Everything was awesome!  Definitely put this place on your list if you'll be in the Dumbo/Brooklyn/Manhattan Bridge area.  Just know that it's a little bit of a walk from the A,F,2 or 3 trains

I have been here a few times and the drinks are very good and pretty much all the food is great.  The beef tartare and steak were delicious but the time I had the chicken for 2 I thought it was a little dry
(Translated by Google) Good view of the Manhattan Bridge  (Original) Buena vista del puente Manhattan

My first time coming it was very packed. A lot of people were at the restaurant, but luckily one of my friends made a reservation so we got a table. I ordered the Smoke Duck. It was so soft and full flavor. It was just delicious, but the pricing was pretty expensive. I wish they would at least have some sides with it instead of just duck, but overall it was yummy!
Good food, nice ambience, great location.

The restaurant is well-decorated and situated in a good location near the waterfront. My dining partner and I chose the “tasting menu” because the dishes looked interesting. In fact, each course of the tasting menu was tiny and not worth the money we paid (although the food was good). I might go back again and avoid the tasting menu at all costs.
Ok place, but I did not like it enough to consider going back
I loved the smoked bread.. It was an appetizer but I ended up ordering an extra serving

The food was good but nothing amazing.  I have a food allergy and the server/sous chef didn't know about ingredients.  We ordered the bone-in fish for 2 and the server gave us an opinion on how we could serve it (to ourselves)but never offered to serve it to us. I would not return.
Awesome
Good staff they made us feel very valued and were helpful.
Awesome food and great ambiance

(Translated by Google) Nice restaurant, with attractive decor. The portions were unfortunately very clear  (Original) Schönes Restaurant,  mit ansprechender Einrichtung.  Die Portionen waren leider sehr übersichtlich
Very attentive service. Reserve before you go.

I was so happy to have stumbled upon Atrium while in the Dumbo area of Brooklyn! Fantastic location and the restaurant had the perfect ambiance to match. I ordered two non alcoholic drinks ( hibiscus iced tea, and rosemary lemonade pictured) Bibb lettuce, and mussels. The herb dressing on the salad was delicious. I was also impressed by how many mussels came with the order as well! It filled me right up. My friend and I also ordered a cheese plate to share which we enjoyed. The wait time for our food did seem a bit long. We did go during prime dinner time (8pm) so keep that in mind as this is a very popular restaurant. Overall I enjoyed my meal here and would certainly come back again.
Service was lackluster and food was decent. Uninspired tourist service vibe

Good. Very Good. A little bit expensive, but still very very good. I was nicely surprised, because the bread and the pasta are very similar to the Italian one. I will surely be back on my next trip to New York!! Also their draft IPA beer is not so bad.
(Translated by Google) A very nice place, good atmosphere, excellent service and very good food  (Original) Un lugar muy agradable, buen ambiente, excelente atención y muy buena comida
Chefs choice servings we're a bit small, but food was tasty
Very good environment and service！The sandwich is huge，feel free to share with friends. The only cons is the tiny restroom😅
(Translated by Google) Magnificent Brunch  (Original) Magnifico Brunch
Good service and food should give it a try!!!
This place is terrific. Our food was delicious, great cocktails, and attentive service.
One of my favorite places to eat in all of NYC
Favourite place! Great food!
We went 1pm and sat at the bar. I don't know if the service was slow because we were at the bar, or because it was busy. I would it was kind of average in terms of atmosphere and food.
Service was not great.  They kep messing up my order.

(Translated by Google) We went here for my mother's birthday. Very attentive staff and delicious food.  (Original) Fuimos aquí por el cumpleaños de mi madre. El personal muy atento y la comida deliciosa.
One of my Dumbo favorites!
Varied and interesting menu. Nice decor.

Beautiful yet boring. This restaurant has a pleasant atmosphere and attractive dishes, but flavor falls short. For the quality and quantity of food I’d expect to pay 25% less.  The biggest highlight was the wall garden hanging in the main dining area.
I loved the fish and the hamburger, some plates are small
Great ambiance, delicious food and superb service. It’s everything you want in a classy spot. Thanks Atrium🙌
Fantastic food and impeccable service, as usual.

Broad choices and fantastically executed dishes abound their menu. If you can't find something you like then you don't like good food. We were also particularly fond of the wine list which is expertly procured to meet the demands of those trying to pair their selections with the food menu. The friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating staff round out a terrific dining experience.
The food was horrible and the prices were too high for a little bit of food! 😣 It probably won't change because they have a great location.
(Translated by Google) Nice place to. Share a good wine  (Original) Nice lugar para. Compartir un buen vino
Decent meal...nothing special....BUT fun location
great staff and dishes. I go here all the time

We got there for brunch, and the quality of the food is good, but the portions are small if you compare them with the price. It’s not really worth it! Also, the rosemary lemonade is just lemonade with a couple of leaves of rosemary in it... disappointing... Our waitress was a little bit clumsy but friendly.

The passion fruit drink was nice, but the lavender is less my type. Oyster and seafood plater was perfect, the duck was a bit too chewy and tough. The sea bass was real good too. The deco of the restaurant is good and overall experience was not bad
Quick service and delicious food

After living and eating in NYC for 5+ years, Atrium Dumbo remains one of my favorite restaurants, in what I believe to be the most beautiful area in all of NYC. The food is always fresh, seasonal and delicious, from the scallops, lobster mac, and pasta carbonara, to my FAVORITE lobster Benedict for brunch (light, citrusy, divine) and biscuits with jam. The dessert menu also features one of my favorite desserts of all time, the panna cotta (blueberry, when available.) The cocktail list and wine lists are also on point, with a varied wine selection and cocktails made with seasonal ingredients that are always delicious (I admit to imbibing on a few each visit.) Great for happy hour, too, where you can order any cocktail on the list (and I'm talking about nice, well-balanced, tasty cocktails), for $8. Literally unheard of. I went here in June for brunch for my birthday, and also sent my family there on Thanksgiving when they were visiting and I had to work. That's how much I love this place. The decor is also lovely and fresh, with a lush living wall of greenery, paired with cool industrial metallic elements and an upstairs area for an intimate vibe. Enjoy a fabulous experience and then walk around beautiful brick building-filled DUMBO, making sure not to miss the incredible view of lower Manhattan from across the water.

My husband took me here for my birthday lastnight. The restaurant is nice but the service was not . we had reservations and when we got there tgey didnt have a table ready for us , not to mention very over priced , my husband wasn't even finished eating and they started to clear the table. I had their angus burger and as soon as we left i became so sick , vomiting. What a birthday night. I will not be going back here.
(Translated by Google) Excellent food and the venue was lovely  (Original) Comida excelente y el local era precioso
The food is as healthy as you’d like it to be, fresh and amazing. Adam, the manger is awesome and will keep us coming back!!!!
This is the same cafe that was called out for their racist employees. At least disguise the name a little better.  You guys closed the old shop n established this one.
Great food. Good location.

This place is not where you want to spend your evening. No water,  no spoons. Coffee was cold, gazpacho soup had a good taste but very small. Service is slow and not very friendly- we are not coming back here

I met my crew here for our bimonthly round table discussions.  We'd looked at several places and eventually settled on this one because it was near some of the other activities we were considering that day.  It seems the stars aligned for us.  Before you even enter the restaurant, feast your eyes on the massive, imposing super structure of the Manhattan Bridge. (Do it for the snap maybe?).  The main floor is pretty wide and has a cutaway view to the kitchen. It's also got this awesome looking greenery along one wall and some elevated table seating.  We arrived on time and were seated on the upper level overlooking the main floor and its beautiful vertical garden. Just behind our table was a wall full of cases of wine bottles which perfectly complemented the wood aesthetic elements.  We didn't sample the lunch fare but instead went with brunch.  I had the steak with scrambled eggs (I can't do eggs Benedict or sunny side up. Don't ask me why). Everything was awesome!  Definitely put this place on your list if you'll be in the Dumbo/Brooklyn/Manhattan Bridge area.  Just know that it's a little bit of a walk from the A,F,2 or 3 trains

What an experience! I finally went to Atrium Dumbo... from the moment I walked in we were given a warm welcome by the maitre d . We were seated right away on the second floor, a gorgeous rustic room, where one can see the racks of the amazing wine selection. Service was impeccable! our server was friendly & knowledgeable. After her suggestions we decided to order the red snapper special & a pasta dish... food was delicious. The maitre’d came to check on us during the course of our meal to make sure all was good. We had a  fantastic time! Great service, food... music, great atmosphere over all! I will be back!!! I do suggest you make a reservation as the place gets pretty crowded
Food is great
This place had the friendliest service! The food was also amazing, try the rapini, it is so good! Highly recommend!

Imagine stubbing your toe or realizing you bought a car with a faulty transmission or even perpetually smelling gas in your kitchen. It's these sorts of scenarios that are reminiscent of the atrium. Sure it's in a nice location. But the place leaks, it's a bloody fortune to buy anything and it caters to tourists so doesn't care about returning customers.  All in all it reminds me if plastic in the ocean and negative things like that. (I went for brunch)
I ordered a Cuban Sandwich and it was really good !

Upscale restaurant in the trendy DUMBO neighborhood with great views of the Brooklyn bridge and Manhattan bridge around the corner. We visited on a Friday evening for dinner but despite the busy time, the staff were very friendly and accommodated our party of 4. Would definitely recommend.

Excellent food and service. Really nice wine menu, lots of small independent vineyards. Atmosphere is terrific

I don’t write reviews often, but this restaurant definitely deserved it. Amazing service, amazing food. The place is small, but the staff was extremely welcoming and checked on us every few minutes to make sure everything was perfect. They gave us their recommendations, and gave samples of their wine until I found one I liked. The smoked duck was divine, along with the frosé. Would DEFINITEY recommend if you’re ever in the DUMBO area.

Excellent service, great food - the best that I've had in a while. The waiters were extremely friendly and checked on us frequently. I highly recommend checking out this place if you are visiting DUMBO!
Really nice food and good service

Great service,  great food,  great location. ...just plain great.

Good meal here. Well presented, good food, long wine list. Let down by price (though no doubt par for the course in NY) and a lack of wine sommelier on a Monday night. Nice atmosphere and would go back though.

Very good place for brunch!!! It’s a pity that we had no chance to try the pancake with chicken, however, the cobb salad, the salmon fillet were pretty delicious, the angus beef burger was nice and the cuban sandwich was okay. The cappuccino was our favorite! The price was reasonable, not because of the food but the atmosphere. Staff were so helpful and friendly. A recommended place for brunch at dumbo!

The duck and steak were fabulous!!! Recommended place. Great service. Good cocktails with happy hour prices. Attentive staff. Medium prices.
Excellent food, friendly and very efficient staff.
Michelen rated for a reason.  Atmosphere is great.  Wasn’t entirely hungry, but Cobb salad was great.
Very good and quite reasonable price. Excellent service. I had 2 dinners there for three nights in Brooklyn.

Wonderful personnel, lovely food and good value for money, nothing to complain about at all!

We love this place for brunch. Its a beautiful location and the food is delicious. The only thing that I would ask management for is to bring some butter or olive oil to the table. They serve the eggs with a delicious toast but nothing to put on.
Great service

Had a rather quick lunch here because I was flying off in the afternoon that day. I was welcomed with great service, however the area is indeed picturesque and popular so expect busy times. Enjoyed their salmon and love love love the twist on the classic carrot cake!
Utterly disappointing Cobb salad.
fine dining in a pleasant atmosphere
Delicious breakfast omelettes, but a bit on the expensive side.

Food was all delicious. Portion sizes were generous. The potato bread was amazing. We had appetizer sized pastas for dinner and were totally satisfied. Cocktails were very tasty with some interesting unique ones.

Bland over priced food, everything needed salt. The fish was well cooked but lacked flavor.  Got the seafood platter, fresh oysters! The Brussels sprouts lacked flavor and was also over priced.  The service was also extremely slow and disappointing. Lon wait time for table and also for food to come out

My in-laws we’re visiting from out of town and I wanted to bring them somewhere special, Atrium did not disappoint! The service was great. The wine list and somm recommendations were excellent and very knowledgeable. We each got a different dessert and pairing, and everyone thought they were some of the best we’ve had. Not too sweet and very good depth of flavor. You also can’t beat the beautiful Brooklyn waterfront. Will be back!

One of the highlights of my trip to NYC. The menu was so interesting it was very difficult to choose what to enjoy! Needless to say it did not disappoint. We will definitely be returning any time we are in New York
Staff is friendly but service can be a bit slow, especially if you come in a group. Food was good...tuna tartare appetizer was the standout for me.

The service here is absolutely incredible. The food is amazing. The tuna tartare is the best I have had in NYC, the duck was smoky and velvety. The sea bass carried contrasting textures that drew so much interest. This is a 1:1000 restaurant. A real gem.

I had briefly heard of Atrium DUMBO and thought I'd check it out once I saw it on Seated's new restaurant list.  The staff at Atrium DUMBO had made my visit seamlessly easy as soon as I walked in the door. My reservation was instantly pulled up and I was pleased to be immediately seated where the panels of greenery are on the ride side of the restaurant. Before my bottom had even touched the chair, my water had been filled and and menus were distributed by the waitress. The food came out in a timely manner and my glass of water was never empty. I got the Kale Caesar Salad as my appetizer and the Fish and Chips as my Entree while my companion got the Heirloom Beets as her appetizer and the Salmon dish as her entree. The Kale Caesar salad was a huge portion that could be shared amongst two. As a dessert I ordered brioche doughnuts and black coffee which came with a cute little jar of brown sugar. It was quality coffee that was definitely worth the extra $3.  I flagged down my lovely waitress who was so excellent in her service that if there was a Grammy for best servicing wait staff, she would be a top contender. My check was brought over in less than a minute and when I asked to split the check, there was no issue since she remembered the specifics of who ordered what between my party of two. Ambience was great. Service was incredible. Food was good. All-in-all my experience with this establishment and with Seated as a booking service was A+.

We came on a whim after trying their other restaurant Beasts & Bottles which was excellent. It was a Thursday after Valentine's Day about 7:45pm. They were busy and the restaurant had great energy. We didn't have a reservation but the host was really kind and set us up for a cocktail at the bar while he prepared a table. 10 minutes or so later, just enough time to finish our cocktail - which was delicious, we were sat. Our server was very friendly and my wife is a vegetarian and our server was very knowledgeable and made a lot of great suggestions. We didn't realize it but they have a friendly sommelier on staff and one of the owners is apparently a Master Sommlier so they had an incredible wine list! We drank a bottle of biodynamic Syrah which really hit the spot with the smoked duck! Don't miss the house baked potato bread or the wild black bass. Finished the night with carrot cake and a little cognac. Fantastic night and this is the best restaurant in DUMBO in our opinion!

Supposed to be a fancy restaurant serves French cuisine. However, the quality of service is not as good as the food. For example, waiter didn’t come to collect the plates after we finished. We needed to ask for him all the time. Also he didn’t clean the table until we asked for it.
Thank you Atrium for an awesome Valentine's Day Dinner!! The food was superb service was outstanding.  As always We had a great dining experience!!
I've always enjoyed this place.  Used to be Dumbo's best spot but in the past 9 months three great places of opened up

Good experience overall. Staff is fantastic and their customer service is on point. However, the food didn't live up to expectations given the price point. Could get similar options with better flavour for half the price. Nevertheless, good spot for a romantic evening due to ambiance and overall experience.
Try the L.I. Duck and beef tartars. They are great! Plus, the wine and cocktails are also wonderful

We have had good food here before but didn't get to enjoy it because the maitre'd saw us waiting to be seated and decided to ignore us and instead chat with some other customers. We were left standing for 10 minutes and decided to leave.  We had our 2.5 year old toddler with us. Extremely unprofessional. There was a different African American maitre'd before who was much nicer.

(Translated by Google) Pleasant. Also ideal for a quick meal to stay close to the Brooklyn Promenade. A little expensive.  (Original) Gradevole. Ideale anche per un pasto veloce per rimanere vicini alla Brooklyn Promenade. Un po' caro.

This place has the worst service.  They act as though they are doing you a favor eating there.  I went there the first time this past Summer. We were bypassed.  I thought, okay, it was a busy Summer evening,  so it happens.  The second time I walked in stood at the host desk for 7 to 10 min.   No one said anything.   Then my very pink sister of the whiter race enters and the host comes over, says hello to her over me and proceeds to take her order.  I left, vowed not to return.  This was in the fall. I saw a manager outside a week later and told him about it, he said he apologized and noted that the place is not like that.  So here I go tonight.  I call to order food to take out.  I was told that the Bronzino was not on the menu, but rather the black bass.   The menu has been changed, so I ask questions.  I am told to refer to Website which had the old menu items on it.  I  expressed this to the operater.  He  was agitated.  I am passed to three different people and the third lets me know "Yes, we are busy seating people and serving, so it is a really busy time to take your order"  I said Okay, No Thank You.  He then says, but I will take it.  I thought Wow, when people are disconnected,  they treat others negatively they loose money.  I am taking my business to Westville.  People, whether eat in or takeout customers, are valuable.  But at the Atruim, all customers are not.  I will go where my dollar, my self and appreciation for the restaurant is received with open arms.  Not again.  Atrium can keep there bad attitude and bad behavior.
Bartender was great. Menu was fun and cocktail list was impressive. Nicely decorated.
Cute restaurant with a good selection

Great food, great service. Had the BEST Mezcal Negroni here, server recommended. Seafood platter is great, burger is delicious. I’d say the cheese plate was a little on the small side. Other than that, it’s fun to sit at the bar seats and watch the kitchen. Best to make a reservation or get there right when they open.

Came here for brunch on the weekend. You don't have to make reservations, but if you do they'll treat you a bit nicer. There are 2 floors, both seems to sit comfortably. The interior design feels nice and fresh. The food and coffee is both very good. The pricing for the bunch menu is a little above average though.
Excellent food and service.
Bad food, overpriced, empty. Service is ok.

TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE!! My family of 5 was out touring NYC. We walked across Brooklyn Bridge and looked on  Open Table for a lunch spot. My wife booked a table at Atrium. We walked in 10 minutes later and were greeted at the door with "cheer …

I made a reservation on OpenTable 15 minutes prior to the reservation time which required my credit card to reserve. We arrived at the restaurant and were handed a tasting menu. We didn’t like what was on the tasting menu and asked if we could order off the regular menu. The waitress said there’s a bar menu we could order from but we’d have to be seated in the bar. Our table was literally right next to the bar area. I asked for the manager and explained we didn’t want the tasting menu. He offered no options so we left. The manager was extremely rude! And they charged my credit card $200 ($40/person) which was a cancellation fee even though I never cancelled the reservation. WT*! Extremely unaccommodating! You don’t treat people this way!!!

Food: Had the croque monsieur - excellent. Blood Mary was a hit. Def recommend fried chicken and waffles.  Ambiance: sat at bar during date and it was super relaxed. Nice airy space.

Great food and service. Friendly servers, they will make you feel at home. For two people it costed about $70 for the drinks and the meal together, so the price is decent. The spaghetti that they served had amazing taste and texture. Great place for dates after walking around Dumbo and Brooklyn bridge area.

GREAT FOOD! Outstanding service. The Manager, Kem, took care of us and every patron that walked through those doors with great courtesy and welcoming demeanor. Definitely recommend and coming back.

This place is amazing! It was my first time in New York and I was blessed to have discovered this place.  They were a bit late with our food due to a couple of celebrities eating at the same time we were but they apologized and gave us drinks in the house. We were already pretty drunk as you can see from the pictures. I was halfway through my food before I realized I was going to be doing this review in the future.  Honestly, if you're in Dumbo go here! The only downside is the drinks are expensive but the views and the potential to meet celebrities makes up for that immensely.
Great service, great food, pleasant staff!

Well cooked food, but overpriced for what they give you. Value is off.

Extremely rude and condescending host! His name was Bryant I believe. Having been in the restaurant business all my life I was very taken back by the disrespect. On this particular day we were exploring the neighborhood and came across …

This is an outstanding modern French restaurant.  Superb food from start to finish, really great wine selections including generous per glass pours, attentive and patient service, gorgeous converted loft space.  A memorable dining experience.

One of the few places that we are able to find near the Brooklyn Bridge that seemed to offer something a little bit different, the quality for the cost just does not live up to the expectations. We ordered two sandwiches for lunch and while my Cubano was decent, but overpriced, my wife's fried eggplant wrap just tasted like nothing smothered in yogurt sauce and wrapped in a bland tortilla. The experience left much to be desired and I would not actively seek to eat here again.
Nice double floor dining space with solid menu items. Conveniently located next to the waterfront!
Food, service, decor, all top quality. The flavorings could have been a bit bolder for my taste, but that's just me.
Beautiful view over the skyline
Sister resto to Beasts and Bottles (which is great) but Atrium somehow misses the mark B&B nails.  Silver lining is they have a killer happy hour with attentive bartenders.

Very attractive space. Had already run out of bread (for which they charge $3) at 7:30 on a Sunday evening. I split the chicken dish with another: chicken pot pie was excellent, other elements were average. Wife had the chitarra dish; she quite liked it but it tasted rather bland to me. We ordered the donuts for dessert; the donuts themselves had no flavor, no sugar coating, etc. they were just balls of fried flavorless dough. They're served with a little dish of a brown sugary syrup that tasted a bit burnt.  Service was incredibly slow. Dinner took 2 hours 30 minutes, and that was for our entrees and dessert. Two courses. Not ok.  Would not recommend.
Always empty but always turning people away. Service pretty bad, while food is pretty good. Overall, not worth the annoyance of dealing with their nonsense.
